item.title: Error: Could not find or load main class EGUI - Help
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“jrbtfc, post:9, topic:544243”]I replaced the run.bat with the information you’ve provided.

I’m getting the cmd window opening and closing very quickly. In a print-screen snap, I was able to make out the following:

C:\Users\mycomputer\Desktop\c1>TITLE Client
’clsjava’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.[/quote]

Edit it in notepad and add a line break in between cls and java. I did the same thing when I was testing. Just have it on a new line.

Read full topic

item.title: Error: Could not find or load main class EGUI - Help
item.dc:creator: @jrbtfc jrbtfc
item.description:
@jrbtfc wrote:

I replaced the run.bat with the information you’ve provided.

I’m getting the cmd window opening and closing very quickly. In a print-screen snap, I was able to make out the following:

C:\Users\mycomputer\Desktop\c1>TITLE Client
’clsjava’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.

When I replaced the java part I get:

C:\Users\mycomputer\Desktop\c1>TITLE Client
the filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect.

item.source: Error: Could not find or load main class EGUI - Help

item.title: Error: Could not find or load main class EGUI - Help
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

You can try replacing your run.bat with this:

TITLE Client
@echo off
cls
java -Xmx800M -cp .;./class; EGUI
pause

If that doesn’t work try replacing “java” with:

But make sure you change Program Files to Program Files (x86) if you’re using 64-bit. And jre8 to jre7.

Read full topic

item.title: Error: Could not find or load main class EGUI - Help
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

TITLE Client
@echo off
cls
java -Xmx800m MISSING ARGUMENTS
pause

I’m not sure, but I’m pretty sure you’re missing some arguments… Is this the correct run?

Actually… That’s what it is (almost positive) where you see the text above that says “Missing Arguments” replace it with EGUI.

If that doesn’t work, take a picture of your client files and post it here, please.

Read full topic

item.title: Error: Could not find or load main class EGUI - Help
item.dc:creator: @jrbtfc jrbtfc
item.description:
@jrbtfc wrote:

Hi, I’m having an issue with a single PC running my client.

The problem: When I run the client, I get “Error: Could not find or load the main class EGUI”.

Steps I’ve taken:

  1. Uninstalled/Reinstalled Java. I’ve installed the same Java (Jre7) as the computer that is working.
  2. Copied the ENTIRE client folder from the working computer, just in case.
  3. PATH’d “C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\Jre7\bin;” in Environment Variables (I had this set like this on the other computer).

FYI:

  1. The working computer is Win8 64-bit.
  2. The non-working computer is Win7 64-bit.
    2a. I’ve also tried the 64-bit version of Java.
  3. I did have the client working on this Win7 64-bit machine, a little while back. Unsure of what changed.
  4. I’m using the source and client from “Delta Blank Source And Client | Delta” by 1mS4m. I found in the downloads section of MoparScape. Link http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,662906.0.html

My runclient info:

TITLE Client
@echo off
cls
java -Xmx800m EGUI
pause

This is the same on both computers.

My EGUI.java file info (also the same on both computers). Currently I’m just trying to get this working on the machine itself (I have the source on both machines for testing).:

import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“127.0.0.1”, “127.0.0.1”, “127.0.0.1”
});
}
}

Since the client is the exact same on both computers, I’m thinking it’s something with the configuration of this computer. What am I missing here? Is there anything else I should check?

Alternative - I’ve been looking into other Source/Clients if anyone has recommendations. I am able to launch other clients/sources from this Win7 machine.

Thanks.

Read full topic
